name: Electronics #2. E12 Series Resistors Values
description:
INTRO

The E series is a system of preferred numbers or values for use in electronic
components. It consists of the E3, E6, E12, E24, E48, E96 and E192 series.
The number after E designates the quantity of steps in each series. This E
series is used with resistors, capacitors, inductors and zener diodes values.
The complete E12 series is:
E12 = [10, 12, 15, 18, 22, 27, 33, 39, 47, 56, 68, 82]
Each value can be in multiples or in submultiples of 10, p.e. 0.1, 2.7, 4700, 22000, etc.
being said value a 'normalized value of resistor'.

TASK

You get a real number (n) in range [1e-3, 1e6] both included.
Your function will returns normalized n.
Imput n is rounded to 3 decimal positions, same as output.

Examples:

```python n = 1925 --> 1800 n = 45254 --> 47000 n = 0.0243 --> 0.022 ```

REMARKS

A number just in the middle of two normalized values will take the minor value.
example:
n = 200 --> 180

Try using logarithms :)
